results.title: Hardi! Pardaillan
results.brief_description:
Pardaillan has been entrusted by King Henri III with a letter he must pass on to Henri de Bearn. King Henri is besieged in the city of Chartres and is asking for help. After surviving many ambushes, Pardaillan must also contend with a fanatical monk who is plotting against the king. This is the second installment of the adventures of Pardaillan. See also: ‘Le Chavalier de Pardaillan’ (X000503) in our collection.

Credits: Producer, Henri Jaquillard ; director, Bernard Borderie ; writers, Henri-Andre Legrand, Andre Haguet, Bernard Borderie ; photography, Henri Persin ; music, Paul Misraki ; costumes, Rosine Delamare.
Cast: Gerard Barray, Valerie Lagrange, Philippe Lemaire, Guy Delorme, Jean Topart.

results.title: Hard work
results.brief_description: A film about Margo St. James and her fight to have prostitution decriminalized. Revolving around the Hooker’s Convention in Washington, D.C., the action takes place over a five-day period. It includes a visit to the Women’s Detention Center, TV and press interviews, a congressional cocktail party, the Hooker’s Ball and a sunrise walk around the White House. It is not a didactic study on the problem of prostitution but a thought and discussion-provoking vehicle that probes the moral and social values involved.

results.title: Hard rubbish
results.brief_description:
A look at everyday life in one community and how it transforms waste into a valuable commodity, from one individual’s discarded object to another’s newly claimed prize possession. Several residents offer their personal insights to curbside recycling or as one discerning person calls it “free-ranging rubbish”, adding that there is a definite rubbish etiquette to be followed.
Music composed and performed by Irma Frieda.

results.title: Hard brought up: child welfare story
results.brief_description: Shows public services available in one US community for answering social problems. When two boys rob a service station, they are brought before the juvenile court. A social worker investigates their family circumstances.

results.title: Happy youth in sun and snow: winter holidays in Switzerland
results.brief_description: This film describes the facilities for children to learn winter sports under expert guidance. Skating, ice hockey, toboganning are shown, and training in skiing from the nursery slopes to racing is seen in some detail. No commentary, music soundtrack only.

results.title: Happy to be me (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Arthur Mokin and Arthur Mokin Productions
results.brief_description: A documentary based on a survey of more than 600 students from kindergarten through high school, that provides an objective view of young people’s attitudes toward gender, or male and female roles. Candid interviews and spontaneous scenes of young people interacting at school, at play, and in the community, help create an awareness of one’s assumptions about maleness and femaleness.

results.title: Happy riding. Part 2
results.creator_credit: Mark Lawton, Euryn Ogwen-Williams, BBC Cymru Wales and Vis News
results.brief_description: Part two in the series on the art of horse riding. The topic of this film is looking after your pony. Tips on successful grooming and care are given by expert John Bateman and includes use of dandy brush, body brush, curvy comb, wisp, sponge. Use of blankets, plaiting and shoeing are also covered.

results.title: Happy riding. Part 1
results.creator_credit: Mark Lawton, Euryn Ogwen-Williams, BBC Cymru Wales and Vis News
results.brief_description: One of a series which examines the art of horse riding. This film deals with buying a pony and other aspects such as what to look for when buying a pony, horse sales, postures, fencing and shelters, feeding, equipment, stable management and veterinary reports

results.title: Happy locomotive
results.creator_credit: Stephen Fitzgerald, Baltimore and Ohio Railroad Company and Unifilm
results.brief_description: An animated film describing the dangers which confront an engine driver. Many of the hazards are caused by unthinking people, children and vandals. Accidents could be avoided if the public remembered simple safety rules.

results.title: Hans Heysen recollections
results.creator_credit: Eugene Schlusser, Reg McLean and Lion's Den Productions
results.brief_description: A comprehensive and personal documentary about the life of one the most renowned painters of the Australian landscape, Hans Heysen. The program centers around interviews with his surviving children, including the Archibald Prize winning artist Nora Heysen, and focuses on the regions around Hahndorf, South Australia, and the Flinders Ranges where his painting was most prolific. It provides a reflective portrayal of his artistry, his concern for the Australian environment, his wide network of supporters and friends, and his influence on others intertwined with a sensitive study of his personal history.
